title.narrative: JUSTICE FOR CHILDREN

description.narrative: Juvenile offenders or victims of crime are treated in accordance with international standards, including a/ shortened pre-trial period, b/ education opportunities for all children in detention, c/ re-integration pre- and post-trial, including diversion and/or alternative sentencing, abd d/ social support and rehabilitative measures for children under 14 years of age., which contributes to Access To Justice, Justice For Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: OUTCOME 1 - GOVERNANCE FOR CHILDREN Effective public oversight and monitoring of institutions help to ensure implementation of policies and programmes addressing the needs and rights of marginalized children.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Juvenile offenders or victims of crime are treated in accordance with international standards, including a/ shortened pre-trialperiod, b/ education opportunities for all children in detention, c/ re-integration pre- and post-trial, including diversion and/oralternative sentencing, abd d/ social support and rehabilitative measures for children under 14 years of age.

description.narrative: UNICEF's advocacy, technical and financial assistance were essential for the development of Albania's draft Criminal Justice for Children Code, as well as for the expansion of measures alternative to detention of children and young people in conflict with the law – now applied in the majority of juvenile offence cases. | Status:Met | As-of Date:10/01/2017

title.narrative: % of juvenile offenders benefitting from diversion measures (including alternatives to detention)
length of pre-trial detention for juveniles
% of detention sites for juveniles ensuring adequate education opportunities

baseline.value: Very limited education opportunities for juveniles in detention

target.value: 2016:Institutional procedures in place to provide education to juveniles in detention

actual.value: 2017:100% of detention sites have arrangements for primary education of juveniles, However, a recent People's Advocate Report indicated that in Lezha detention facility, classrooms looked like they were not used for a long time and that juveniles were not in the classrooms at a time of the day where they

title.narrative: clearly defined channels in place in public administration for lodging complaints related to children

baseline.value: no clearly defined channels in place

actual.value: 2017:Draft Criminal Justice for Children Code and draft Law on Child Rights and Protection (both under parliamentary review) improve children's position as rights holders in relation to administrative and judicial processes. A draft Legal Aid Law, is also under parliamentary review.

title.narrative: system in place to monitor that children in contact with the law (whether civil, administrative or criminal) are treated according to standards

actual.value: 2017:Draft Criminal Justice for Children Code currently under parliamentary review
